Waterfront Rescue Mission: 380 West Herman Street, Pensacola, FL
Waterfront continues serving Escambia County's homeless community, with limited staff and limited resources.

We continue to tell those seeking shelter and other services that Waterfront is not a good long-term solution during this challenging time, and we encourage them to seek other options if possible. Waterfront has furloughed 93% of its staff, thus leading to the reduction and limitation of services.
The public is encouraged to follow Waterfront Rescue Mission and Waterfront Thrift Stores on Facebook for updates.

In an abundance of caution and to help ensure a safe and healthy environment for both our staff and those we serve, we are following the advice of health experts. We are doing the following to mitigate risks of infections, as we serve a vulnerable population, with limited staff and limited resources, effective April 3:
· Day services for the homeless community- Showers, hand-washing stations, restrooms, mail service: 6-8 a.m. M-F, with lunch service suspended.

· Overnight shelter for men- very limited capacity to allow safety and social distancing, first come first serve basis. Clients must already be in the Homeless Management Information System database. Shelter available 4p-6a CDT, with check in daily 4-6 p.m.

ul.li: We ask Covid-19 health screening questions for guests staying overnight, and refer for health care providers if symptoms exist.
Staff and guests observe recommended practices, including social distancing and personal hygiene.
Thrift stores and donation pickup- temporarily closed
